summary:
The Coptic Orthodox Church is a Christian church mainly found in Egypt. It was started by Mark, one of Jesus' followers, around the year 42 AD. They follow their own rituals and have their own pope, who leads from Cairo. This church is the largest Christian group in the Middle East and North Africa.

After Egypt was taken over by Islamic rulers, the church moved its headquarters to Cairo. Over time, many Egyptians started calling themselves Coptic Orthodox to stand out from other Christian groups. Recently, Coptic Christians have faced more religious discrimination and violence in Egypt.
title: Coptic Orthodox Church
